search.query: (index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_replay_modalert.log") "JIRA Service Desk ticket creation has failed" | stats count

lu.li: When a JIRA issue creation is requested, the modular alert attempts a rest call to JIRA and logs its activity in (index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_modalert.log")
If the JIRA issue creation is successful, the keyword "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully created" and the issue reference are returned and logged

Should the JIRA creation fail for any reason, the keyword "JIRA Service Desk ticket creation has failed" is logged, and the issue data is stored automatically in the replay KVstore (| inputlookup jira_failures_replay | eval uuid=_key)

This is a temporary failure as the replay backend handles automatically failed issues stored in the KVstore, and attempts again the creation via the scheduled alert "JIRA Service Desk - Resilient store Tracker"
The replay issue backend logs its activity in (index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_replay_modalert.log")
Tickets stored in the replay KVstore are attempted when the replay alert triggers (every 5 minutes), a temporary failed ticket will be attempted during a period of 3 days

Once the ticket referenced by a uuid has reached the 3 days period, it is tagged as a permanent failure, and the alert "JIRA Service Desk - detection of permanent issue creation failure" triggers warning about its permanent failure

A ticket in a permanent failure state will not be attempted anymore, 7 days after its initial creation, the ticket is finally tagged for removal and will be purged automatically from the replay KVstore
As such, a JIRA issue that initially failed to be created is automatically retried during 3 days, and definitively purged after 7 days

Each JIRA issue created is recorded in the backlog KVstore collection and associated with a unique MD5 hash, if the dedup option is enabled (per alert) and the same content is submitted again, a new comment will be added to the issue instead of a brand new issue created.

search.query: (index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") ( (source="*jira_service_desk_modalert.log") OR (source="*jira_service_desk_replay_modalert.log") ) "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully created" OR "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully updated" OR "JIRA Service Desk ticket creation has failed" | rex "\"key\":\"(?<jira_issue>[^\"]*)\"," | eval jira_simple_status=case( match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully created"), "success", match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully updated"), "success_update", match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket creation has failed"), "temporary_failure") | timechart minspan=5m bins=1000 count by jira_simple_status | append [ search (index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_replay_modalert.log") "permanent failure!" | timechart minspan=5m bins=1000 count as permanent_failure ]

(index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_modalert.log") | rex "\"key\":\"(?<jira_issue>[^\"]*)\"," | transaction pid startswith="Alert action jira_service_desk started." | eval jira_transaction_status=case( match(_raw, "\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}\s\d{1,2}:\d{1,2}:\d{1,2}\,\d{1,3}\sERROR"), "failure", match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully created"), "success", match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully updated"), "success_update", match(_raw, ".*"), "info") | stats first(jira_transaction_status) as jira_transaction_status, first(app) as app, first(action_mode) as action_mode, values(sid) as sid, first(search_name) as search_name, first(user) as user, latest(_raw) as _raw by _time | sort - _time | eval icon="icon|" + case( jira_transaction_status="info", "ico_unknown ico_small|icon-info|JIRA workflow information", jira_transaction_status="failure", "ico_error ico_small|icon-close|JIRA issue creation has failed or an error was encountered", jira_transaction_status="success", "ico_good ico_small|icon-check|JIRA issue successfully created", jira_transaction_status="success_update", "ico_good ico_small|icon-check|JIRA issue successfully updated") | search $status$ | fields _time icon app sid search_name user _raw | rename icon as status

(index="_internal" OR index="cim_modactions") (source="*jira_service_desk_replay_modalert.log") | rex "\"key\":\"(?<jira_issue>[^\"]*)\"," | transaction pid startswith="Alert action jira_service_desk_replay started." | eval jira_transaction_status=case( match(_raw, "\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}\s\d{1,2}:\d{1,2}:\d{1,2}\,\d{1,3}\sERROR"), "failure", match(_raw, "JIRA Service Desk ticket successfully created"), "success", match(_raw, ".*"), "info") | stats first(jira_transaction_status) as jira_transaction_status, first(app) as app, first(action_mode) as action_mode, values(sid) as sid, first(search_name) as search_name, first(user) as user, latest(_raw) as _raw by _time | sort - _time | eval icon="icon|" + case( jira_transaction_status="info", "ico_unknown ico_small|icon-info|JIRA workflow information", jira_transaction_status="failure", "ico_error ico_small|icon-close|JIRA issue creation has failed or an error was encountered", jira_transaction_status="success", "ico_good ico_small|icon-check|JIRA issue successfully created") | search $status$ | fields _time icon _raw | rename icon as status
